main event: A UFO sighting was reported over Pasadena, California on March 6, 1957, and over Oxnard, California on the night of March 23 and the early morning of March 24, 1957.
interesting points: The Pasadena sighting was considered to be caused by the exhaust glow of a passing aircraft.
Multiple reliable observers reported seeing a silent, bright red object in the sky over Pasadena, with some claiming to have heard a 'roar' when the object's white light flashed.
No Air Force personnel saw the object, and radar contact with the object was not established.
In Oxnard, a UFO was reported to have 'swooshed' low over a car driven by a member of the U.S. Navy, passing all the way to the other side of the U.S. Naval Station.
Despite speculation that the object may have been a balloon, no tracking balloons were found to account for the sightings in Pasadena and surrounding areas.
sighted object: bright red object in the sky
witnesses: air force personnel, Pasadena residents, U.S. Navy member
